replies.body: I believe it's because of the white balance and what you best see in. Night owls, and people who don't use lights as often - ie, people who play games or such at late night, with only their computer as light are much more likely to see it as its "correct color". I am more of a day person, though not a morning person, and I play with at least one light on. I'm more inclined to see it as white and gold, though I've seen it as both.
replies.body_tagged: I believe it's because of the white balance and what you best see in. Night owls, and people who don't use lights as often - ie, people who play games or such at late night, with only their computer as light are much more likely to see it as its "correct color". I am more of a day person, though not a morning person, and I play with at least one light on. I'm more inclined to see it as white and gold, though I've seen it as both.

replies.body:
Oh my lord... This dress is everywhere.. http://www.wired.com/2015/02/science-one-agrees-color-dress/

It's actually blue and black by the way, people who see it as white and gold, their retinas just take a little more time to sort out the colours. So if you stare at it long enough, it most likely will turn blue. I can see both >:)

replies.body: For me I see blue and black. The person I believe who first posted it says that it is actually white and gold in real life, but looks black and blue for some other people due to bad lighting. The view of the colours may also change depending on your mood. Using paint, one can easily find that it is blue and black in the photo, but once again it is due to bad lighting.
replies.body_tagged: For me I see blue and black. The person I believe who first posted it says that it is actually white and gold in real life, but looks black and blue for some other people due to bad lighting. The view of the colours may also change depending on your mood. Using paint, one can easily find that it is blue and black in the photo, but once again it is due to bad lighting.

replies.body:
My friend showed this to me yesterday, and at first glance it looked white and gold to me. I kept looking at it and it just turns out that the lighting was very, very high, which is why it appears to be white and gold.

The dress really is blue and black though. :P

The dress really is blue and black though. :P
